result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott A Pense was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 3:17pm [mo]
Defendant Scott A Pense in court with Attorney Bradley J Jansen.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance, submits a victim impact statement, notes the victim is present in the gallery

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Count #2, the Court IMPOSES 2 years &  9 months in the Wisconsin State Prison, the Court STAYS this sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years.

Shall the STAYED Prison sentence be Imposed, it will consist of  an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  2  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 9 months.  

Conditions of Probation are: 
--to serve 60 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence on   8/18/15 at    7:00pm.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to maintain absolute sobriety (no alcohol, no controlled substances without valid prescription, take all prescription drugs as prescribed)
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to undergo mental health assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--Complete Certified Batterers Intervention treatment
--to any other undergo assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no acts or threats of violence
--to submit DNA sample upon demand by designee/ Sheriff
--to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge plus $100 Domestic Abuse surcharge

Days credit for time already served:  1  days
Felony Firearm Prohibitions/Voting Ineligibility Notice given 

Mr. Pense is to report to the Jefferson Probation Office tomorrow
recess: 4:16pm
NOH for Def. for 8/4/15 Status Conference//sent to LKA

Case called at 11:25am [mo]
Defendant Scott A Pense in court with Attorney Bradley J Jansen.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Mr.Pense waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered

Atty. Pense orally motions for a bond modification, to remove the no contact with Ms. Raley.
The Court directs Atty. Jansen to submit an written motion for such issue; the instructs Atty. Jansen to request an early morning time with the Court's JA if he would like this Motion expedited
recess: 11:32

NEXT: Status Conference on 8/4/2015 at 2:30pm
Notice of Hearings 1)Pretrial Conf. on 7/1/15 and 2)Status Conf. 7/14/15 sent to LKA

ADDRESS INFO for Scott A Pense
Current: 307 Schroeder Ave., Palmyra, WI 53149 United States  (Effective: 06-03-2015)
Prior: 614 S. Whitewater Ave, Jefferson, WI 53549
original bond document received from JESO on 6/1/15

Case called at 1:29pm [mo]
Defendant Scott A Pense appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD will appoint counsel).  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Atty. Svehlek indicates that Mr. Pense is eligible for PD representation
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived,
The Confirms Mr. Pense's date of birth and address on Criminal Complaint
The charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2500  signature bond, with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--no contact with Candy Raley
--no presence at 614 S. Whitewater Ave, Jefferson, WI (one time return with law enforement to retrieve personal items, within 7 days) 
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence at bars, taverns, or package houses
--  No alcohol possession or ingestion. 
-- The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.

The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  The Defendant is to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse on Monday June 1, 2015 before noon.
recess 1:40  pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on July 1, 2015 at 9:40am   (2) Status Conference on July 14, 2015 at 10:30am
